title: Drawing, "Design for a Pavilion", ca. 1780s
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and rose, blue, black and gray watercolor on paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pencil on the verso in a 20th century hand: 1609 / Coupe d'un hotel LXVI; indication of scale in "toises" and various penciled numbers at lower center
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sale, May 19, 1896, no. 526); Leon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Section of a villa with three rooms.  Steps lead to the front and rear entrances of the main floor.  The frame is in the rear of a portico and leads to a hall behind which a love room is attached.  A wall panel with a statue is shown there.  It is flanked by two doors from which stairways lead up and down where a room in trellis architecture is suggested.  There is an indication of the scale at lower margin, at the center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Pavilion", ca. 1780s.
ca. 1780s. Pen and black ink, brush and rose, blue, black and gray watercolor on paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-283.
